newsitem.title: DENMARK: Carlsberg plans interactive TV commercial.
newsitem.headline: Carlsberg plans interactive TV commercial.

text.p: Danish brewer Carlsberg is to air what it believes is the world's first interactive television commercial on Tuesday evening, with a spot for its Tuborg Super Light beer on the country's TV2, a Carlsberg spokesman said.
The 90-second live spot will give viewers the chance to direct, by telephone, the figure of a Tuborg delivery van as it attempts to negotiate a maze.
Succesful callers will win a crate of the virtually non-alcoholic beer. The spot will run nightly, except Saturdays, until May 28.

The idea for the ad, to air immediately after TV2's evening news programme, came from advertising agency Wibroe Duckert and Partners and the game was developed by Interactive Broadcast Systems. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33 969650
